radiographic_examinations.findings: The gallbladder appears distended, and multiple gallstones are seen which appear mobile. There is no gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. The common bile duct is normal in caliber, measuring 4 mm. No sonographic ___ sign is present. The liver is normal in echogenicity without focal abnormalities. Color Doppler interrogation of the main portal vein demonstrates normal hepatopetal flow. Limited views of the right kidney demonstrate no hydronephrosis.
